Package com.fortify.client.ssc.connection

This package provides the main functionality for accessing the SSC REST API.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ISSCConnectionRetriever
    Marker interface that extends IRestConnectionRetriever to differentiate from other (non-SSC) connection retrievers, for example when using auto-wiring.
    ISSCTokenFactory
    Factory interface for SSC authentication tokens.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BasicSSCRestConnectionConfig  
    SSCAuthenticatingRestConnection
    This class provides an authenticated REST connection for SSC.
    SSCAuthenticatingRestConnection.SSCAuthenticatingRestConnectionBuilder
    This class provides a builder pattern for configuring an SSCAuthenticatingRestConnection instance.
    SSCBasicRestConnection
    This class provides a basic, non-authenticating REST connection for SSC.
    SSCConnectionRetriever
    This AbstractRestConnectionRetriever implementation provides functionality for configuring and creating an authenticated SSC REST connection.
    SSCRestConnectionConfig<T extends SSCRestConnectionConfig<T>>
    This class extends AbstractRestConnectionWithUsernamePasswordConfig, adding functionality for configuring an SSC authentication token (in addition to configuring SSC user name and password as provided by our superclass).
    SSCTokenFactoryTokenCredentials
    This class is used to properly encode an existing SSC authentication token for accessing the SSC REST API.
    SSCTokenFactoryUserCredentials
    This class is used to generate SSC tokens for accessing the SSC REST API.

Package com.fortify.client.ssc.connection Description

This package provides the main functionality for accessing the SSC REST API. The main entry point is SSCAuthenticatingRestConnection, which handles SSC authentication (username/password-based or token-based) and other low-level details.

Instances of this class can be constructed through the SSCAuthenticatingRestConnection.builder() method, which is mostly suitable for programmatic instantiation. Alternatively, you can use SSCConnectionRetriever, configuring the connection through the com.fortify.client.ssc.connection.SSCConnectionRetriever#getConfig() method. This method is mostly suitable for configuration-based instantiation, like Spring XML configuration, and allows you to auto-wire the SSCConnectionRetriever instance to all classes that require access to SSC.

Once you have acquired an SSCAuthenticatingRestConnection instance, this instance provides low-level access to any SSC REST API endpoint, using the various executeRequest() methods. More high-level functionality is available through the AbstractRestConnection.api(Class) method.
